column3: str
This Ananta battlemaid wants to cheer up a friend's father.
Speak with the Ananta battlemaid.
Speak with the stonemason.
Speak with the Ananta battlemaid.
Search for the stonemason's hammer in the designated area.
Deliver the stonemason's hammer to the stonemason.
I require your help to deliver sssomething of value.
A ssstrider I was pleased to call friend recently died in battle. I want to deliver a bracelet of his to his father.
If memory ssserves, they hailed from a village called Ala Gannha. I would go there by myssself, but I worry my appearance might frighten them.
That is why I would like you to accompany me. To show I come in peace. Now, let usss make our way there.
I have been waiting for you, ssstrider. I believe my friend sssaid his father was a ssstonemason who is fond of fishing.
I will wait here ssso I do not cause a commotion. Please bring my friend's father to me once you have located him.
I will wait here ssso I do not cause a commotion. Please bring my friend's father to me once you have located him.
I don't believe we've met?
You've come with an Ananta to deliver my son's bracelet? I had been wondering if anyone was going to bring me his former possessions.
I first heard of his passing a while ago from a Resistance fighter. Initially, I resented both the Empire <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> the Resistance equally for taking him from me.
However, now I have calmed down somewhat. I'm oh so proud of my boy. He did everything he could to free us from the Empire's clutches.
My thanks to you and this Ananta for bringing his bracelet back to me. I shall go collect it now.
My thanks to you and this Ananta for bringing my son's bracelet back to me.
Thank you, ssstrider.
Your ssson treated all races equally. He would often talk to me fondly of his family.
He sssaid you made that bracelet for him just before he left to join the Resissstance.
I was ssso moved by this I tried to make my own. Alasss, it did not go very well.
I'd no idea he spoke of me to his friends. Thank you for sharing that with me.
How about I make you a similar bracelet as a token of my gratitude?
I would like that very much.
In that case there is one thing I need your help finding first.
Ever since I lost my boy, I've been drinking a little more than usual and well...it seems I managed to misplace my hammer while I was somewhat inebriated.
Understood. I shall sssearch for this hammer.
Ssstrider, please lend me your help as well. It may not be easy to find.
Let me know if you find the ssstonemason's hammer.
My memory's so foggy I honestly have no idea where I lost it.
That's the one! Thank you so much. Now I can set about making another bracelet.
Would you mind telling me more about my son while I work?
It would be my pleasure. I have many fond memories of him.
Thank you for your help, ssstrider.
